reviewText:
Costume quest is a small, but fun game about saving your sibling after he/she is kidnapped by monsters who are trying to steal all of the candy. The objective of the game is to go to each area, collect candy as well as costumes (hence the name costume quest) and fight any monsters that cross your path.

The game style is turn based combat with each costume giving you a different ability, and different quicktime event-like buttons to press to do more damage. The one little problem I have with the game is the fact that the (spoiler alert) French Fry and Vampire costume quicktime event/button press can prompt you to mash the shift key. On Windows, this is a little bit of a nuisance, as the game will minimize and ask if you want to turn sticky keys on. It isn't that big of a deal however, due to the fact that it's a turn based game.

The game is not too much of a challenge if you can find the right combinations of costumes and battle stamps with which to fight the enemies. One can easily finish all of the quests simply by playing the game and not going too far out of the way to complete objectives.

The characters are lovable (even the grubbins), the style is pretty cool, and the story, while not too exciting, is fun.

I would reccomend trying it out.

I really wanted to like this game. The graphics are cute and the premise is great but it really didn't live up to expectations.

For starters, I had hoped a game from Double Fine would not rely on repetition quite so much to bulk out an already short game. The main story has only four enemy types, repeated with three different skins, at least two of the costumes are identical in attacks and powers and each of the levels has exactly the same set of quests - bob for apples, find the hide and seekers, unlock a door by collecting something.

That would have been fine if it was as fun to play the game as it was to follow the short story but there is virtually no challenge. Other than dying from missing one too many quicktime presses, it is near impossible to lose a fight and even when you do, your characters appear unscathed where you left them, without even a loss of candy. I was bored by the end and was thankful for the incredibly short playtime.

On MAC - The text is to fast to read.  its like read a paragraph or 2 in 1 second.  our whole house could not read it.  theirs no option to slow down the text and sadly their are some parts of the game that you can wait to read the text and press next but then the rest of the game theirs no option and its not understandable.  I got this game for a kid to help with his reading for halloween but I can’t even read it to him.   If this is fixed I will delete this as soon as I notice and write a good review.

The art, story, atmosphere, and combat in this game are great. It's overall good.

However, I have a few gripes. When something is in the foreground it's at just the wrong level of transparency to hurt your eyes. The level of difficulty is a little low for my liking. The gameplay gets progressively more and more linear as the game progresses, especially in character progression. Which isn't a good thing in a psuedo-rpg.

Overall it's definitely fun and I find myself pretty addicted to the combat system. Worth a buy.

Another fun and offbeat game from the folks at Double Fine. Its Halloween and hi-jinks are afoot, you play a group of kids out to rescue the main characters sibling who has been captured by an evil witch. Combat is of the turn based variety you are used to seeing in Japanese Style RPG's, your party on one side and the enemy on the other. Hey, come back here, its not dull at all, you see, the kids you have in your party? They can transform into the costumes they are wearing, dressed as a knight? Bam you are a knight in shining armour dealing blows with your sword. Dressed as a robot? Suddenly you are as huge as Voltron and dealing some serious harm. Its the kind of wish fulfilment any kid has when they dressed up as a kid and Double Fine tap into that nostalgic vibe with their usual charm and whimsy. If I have a complaint its minor and its simply that the combat can get a little repetetive, but thats more a flaw in the nature of this style of combat than any glaring fault on Double Fine's part. That little gripe aside, the humour and tongue in cheek Halloween take make this another good addition to Double Fine's stable. That said, pick Iron Brigade or Stacking first if your Double Fine collection is lacking those, this is a fine game but those are musts.

terrible title.

got this as part of one of the humble bundles. didnt expect much with such a mundane title, but it was actually pretty entertaining. this is essentially paper mario with about 3-4 hours of gameplay value.

if you buy it, get it on sale.
GREAT GAME WORTH THE BUY ' AND PLAY TIME

Costume Quest was one of the game(s) that I was able to watch my significant other play and watch her have the time of her life.
Costume Quest suprisingly is quiet difficult for ( what seems ) like a game for younger crowd, it requires strategy when it comes to combat from - What is the best 'lay-out' to the best attacks and when to use them.

I found the combat system reminded me a lot of Final Fantasy system, which I really enjoyed with this game.

Pros :
- Great gameplay
- Funny commentary
- Great feel to the combat system
- Story-line was interesting

Cons :
- (Seems) like this game could be difficult for the younger crowd.
- Too short! Wish I could have more to play!!

Over and all; if you are considering this game...Get it! Well worth your dollars!

9.5/10
Good game, lots of fun. I could only wish for more levels.
Everything I wish Halloween Was rolled into one game and its Fun One of Double fines Great games its humorus, Adventurous and FUN

If the thought of children in Halloween costumes, parading around for candy is your kind of thing, then you should probably get some help. On the other hand, if you're just bored and fancy a Final Fantasy-style game by the makers of Psychonauts, then you're in luck. This game is more fun than a clown on ecstasy.
Great introductory game for my kids. CC gets them used to RPG / quest mechanics to help them see the different types of gaming is in the market.

This game is really fun, and easy to play. The plot is interesting, as well as the different costumes your character can wear. Each costume serves a purpose for - and out of - battle. The dialogue is simple, and the humor is great. I would definitely recommend this to anyone who'd like a Halloween-based game.

Trick or treating is now at your fingertips year round in Costume Quest! This absolutely adorable games leads you on an adventure to save your sibling from monsters. Collect gross treats, buy powerups with candy, and change out your team's costumes for special abilities.

However, there are faults. The game does get tediously repetitive after about an hour in. With about four different areas, you are performing the same side quests every time and battling similar monsters in a different arena. With the amount of constant battling, I wish combat would be a bit more interesting but unfortunately it just got painfully boring after a while and became a chore. The only redeeming factor of battles is the cutscenes when performing a special ability relative to the costumes your team is wearing. The design of costumes in battle was really well done and unique. Gaining new costumes to see in game was the only thing keeping me going after about 5 battles.

All the faults and boredom aside, it's still a cute and fun game that's definitely worth the sale price! I wouldn't buy it at its full price but it is festive fun nonetheless for all ages.
Very cute fun game with a simple enough battle system.

So in this little number you are some bratty kiddo that goes around trying to save the Holiday from evil candy stealing monsters.  I actually liked the play style of this game and a couple parts prooved to be a bit challanging to figure out.  I would recommend people give it a try if they are looking for something that is less mass murder and more sweet toothy like.

This game is quite simple in all aspects but i say that as a good thing. The story takes a path that i always enjoy, the view of children from mundane events turned incredible by their imagination.

The gameplay is extremely simple and gets kinda boring after a while but the Double Fine humor imprinted in the dialogs around the game makes it all worth it.

While i played it i kept thinking how this would be an excellent game to introduce a small child to the concepts of turn based rpg due to its simplicity, so if you are a parent i recommend this game as a gift for them.
It was really fun to play
Hilarious game, but ludicrously well-made and thought out\n\n10/10 would halloween again

A Fun game for when Halloween rolls around, a unique premise for an rpg to be sure and it is full of funny and cute moments. It comes with the christmas dlc free grubbins on ice". If you are too old to trick or treat this is a nice game to play while eating a big bag of discount candy on halloween and again during christmas with the dlc."
Such a cute little halloween game. Only annoying thing is the lack of maps.
My team consists of a giant robot, a unicorn, and a french fry monster.\n\nWhat more could you want?
Very cute and addicting game. Story is very nice.
Battle becomes a little monotonous, but DoubleFine's sense of humor is represented throughout, making it worth checking out for that alone.

Now that I've beaten Costume Quest and the Grubbins on Ice DLC expansion I feel that I can review it properly. This game was fantastic! I don't beat many of my games because of time constraint, so it speaks a lot to a game when I actually finish it. This game was a fantastic nostalgic trip. Its an awesome adventure game by DoubleFine (those guys rock). In this game, whatever haloween costume you are wearing you transform into for battle. Great game! ~PR0XIDIAN

It feels more like an internet game than a full game, but the game itself is pretty nice. You have to gather different costumes, which have different abilities. It gives the game a slight RPG feeling, even though the possbilities are very limited. Once you get used to the graphics (kiddy look), it's really playable and if you like to collect achievements (counting on the fact that you're already bored), this makes it a very interesting game. The creators want to show you every cutscene though. That's boring. 7/10

reviewerDisplayName: BACK ONLINE VIA DIAL UP AOL
reviewText: Overall a great little adventure. Everything DoubleFine does is good, this is no exception.
Well played Double Fine. Again. Damn! Your games are good!

This game is great for those that are looking for a casual experience. Even better is that it's suitable for all ages, so don't let the name or theme fool you.
I particularly liked the humor in this game. The variety of costumes and abilities however, is offset by the fact that soon after you get the basics of the game, battles become very tiresome.
The game also offers a bit of strategy... no seriously, combining the correct costumes with the correct abilities (battle stamps), and choosing who attacks what and with what is pretty enjoyable, challanging, and evenrewarding once you reach the harder enemies.

All in all, this game is casual, so if you're looking for adventure or action, you've com to the wrong place.
This game is an ok, maybe better for a younger audience.
Cute game.  Simple combat but the different costume powers keep it fun and it is really easy to 100% the achievements.  Worth a playthrough if interested in a casual game to relax with.

Perfect example of quality over quantity.  Nice fun little RPG that has you battling monsters as super versions of your costumes.  Simple but entertaining and made by Double Fine Studios.  What more could you ask for?  Unicorns, Yetis, and Flying Space Warriors you say?  They have those too.
A charming RPG reminiscent of Nintendo's brushes with the genre.
awesome game . turn based rpg  mixed with a unique , fun concept of trick or treating. .
Great game but too short even with the DLC it's less than 8h. I suppose some of the Trick or Treating aspect could've got a bit dull going forward but otherwise more costumes would've been ace.

Really solid RPG in a lot of ways. The dialogue is interesting and varied, the world is simple but vast, the quests are varied, but the basic mechanics of battle are striaght-forward and enjoyable. The trailer doesn't do it any justice. If you historically like RPGs, you're going to find that it plays a lot more similarly than it might first seem.

Very funny, very cute, and enjoyable game play. Easy to master, fun to play.

A definitely must-have for the casual gamer who wants to smile and have some good old fashioned, trick-or-treating, monster-butt-kicking, little-brother-saving time.

8/10
so much fun
this game is cute with amazing gameplay for a child absloutly awesome! and amazing ideal too!
This is a nice game. You can get a lot of fun from it, the story is cool. Maybe the only problem is that sometimes you have to do the same several times.

Halfway through and although the combat can get repetitive, the game saves itself several times over and exceeds my expectations with organic and legitimately silly dialogue, an engaging variety of costumes to choose from, a swift pace that never feels like I'm grinding for exp or like it's going too fast, and a story that is outlasting what I originally thought would only be a 2 or 3 hour long game!

At the end of the day, the question is, But is it fun?"

I'm a unicorn."
very good game. I had a lot of fun playing this!
Quite a fun puzzle game with interesting mechanics. Definitely recommend for puzzle lovers.
Cute game that will make you wish it was Fall any day of the year.

I've played a coupld Double FIne games and they have yet again made a well rounded game.

The game itself is simple yet at the same time can be complex in its own right with the simple RPG elements. The combat for the most part boils down to timed button pressing and selecting the right Battle Stamp for each character(these are basically special stat boosters) and earning xp to level up and Candy as currency to buy Battle Stamps to use in combat.

Graphics alone are what really help to sell the game since the art style is so quirky and unique that it suits the comical style of the game.

As for story and characters its almost like Tim Shafer took the Peanuts comics and made his own twisted version of it(in a good way) but for the most part the story is VERY simple but you don't notice that because the characters are the selling point honestly.


10/10 Overall it was a fun little game that you can beat in around 6 to 8 hours depending if you're a completionist or not and regardless if you're a little kid or a 30+ something adult you will enjoy this little game.

All right, Costume Quest was a fun little game. To sum it up in three words: Baby's First J-RPG"

The strongest point of Costume Quest is the writing. The banter reminds me of old Cartoon Network shows like Powerpuff Girls and Dexter's Laboratory. It pretty much carried the game for me.

The gameplay itself is familiar from Chrono Triggers and Final Fantasies. Turn-based hit point reduction. I don't see anyone who has played a turn-based game being challenged by the combat.

But in the end
date: the game is clearly developed for children. And unlike most children's games
recommended: this one has intelligence and wit behind it. I would recommend this to people who would like to give their child or child-like entity an easy and painless foray into the wondrous world of turn-based games."

reviewText: This is an easy, quick, and fun Halloween themed game. I would recommend it.
Although this is a very repetitive Game after playing it for just five minutes you will be pulled into its quirky graphics and cool battle animations. Definatly worth a play if its on sale :D.

I really loved this game and had loads of fun playing it. I absolutely love the unicorn and the eyeball costumes.

I'm not a hardcore gamer but I managed to get all the achivements and complete the game so its not exceptionally challenging but there is enough content to keep you going and the battles are fun.

The humour keeps you engaged so you want to come back for more and its not a chore to get to the next part of the story. As well as the main story quests there are various side quests (that sometimes involve minigames) that arent essential but are really fun so I'm sure most people play them.

Overall I would give 8/10 for having  a fun story and battle mode but it could be a little more challenging outside of the battles.
sweet charming little game well worth a run, funny and enjoyable, got it on sale and it was worth it

Great game if you have a little time on your hands.  It streamlines the RPG experience with a simpler exploration feel that keeps the user involved until the end.  The biggest drawbacks are the repetive, three button combat and length.  Sadly, you can 100% this game in less than 8 hours if you care to.  What it DOES provide though, is a unique take on a RPG system that does not really require grinding.  The game does a great job of facilitating just enough combat to keep you at the appropriate level without the need to do extra legwork.  All in all, I'd give it 4/5, and a high recommendation.
It's Halloween, you wear costumes and do quests. Really, what more do you want? Oh and it's funny too!
Costume quest was a fun game, to bad the game didnt come with real candy lol!

This game has become a seasonal staple for me around Halloween. It's art and music is perfect, and engenders that nostaglic feeling of being a kid in a costume. You're not wearing a cardboard costume, you ARE a spaceman, or a ninja, or a robot.

Really fun, and memorable.

Funny, cute, and a enjoyable to play. What more do you need? Try it during halloween to really get into the mood and relive your childhood Trick or Treat" memories... mixed in with turn based RPG combat of course."

What an amazing game!  It might seem like this is just a simple kids game, but it is actually so much fun!  The combat sequences change with each battle which keeps you on your toes, and it is a great deal of fun questing for the patterns and costume pieces, then trying them all out to experience the various special abilities of each one.  There is a lot of humour in the dialog and the art is also very good.

Costume Quest is a bit like Final Fantasy in the battle sequences, but the rest of the game is pretty unique and I definitely recommend it.  I've put many hours in so far and am not done with it by a long shot!
A cute and imaginative game.

Utterly charming QTE/JRPG blend.  Mechanics are simple but quick so avoid the dragging fighting of the genre at large.\n\nFunny, clever, and engrossing - this is a game that can be enjoyed inspite of it's mechanics, rather than because of them.

Double Fine at its best. A creative and funny game about halloween. Finally, a game where character selection isn't just male or female, but the choice between two different personalities altogether. I cannot reccomend this game enough.
Cute with round  based combat and quick time events.

Straight forward RPG fun with a nice look to it. Only thing that lets it down is the fight mechanics, which are basic and mean that replay isn't on the books. Around 8 hours of gameplay total (including all of the side missions and hidden achievements)
Great game from DoubleFine. Met all my expectations and more.

Adorable, witty and fun, this game is exactly the thing you want for a lazy Saturday. Not too much thinking to do, but plenty engaging. A good number of little side questy-type things to keep you busy- a good length game overall, and then, for a bonus, another few hours in the expansion! Overall, a game I would recommend to anybody!

Costume Quest is a great little game with cute characters and quirky quests. If you're looking for something casual but still a lot of fun, I'd definitely recommend it.\n\nSometimes it crashes though so be sure to save often!
Cute, simple, and engaging. Costume Quest is a game for wasting time in a fun and light hearted way.

A great little Game from DoubleFine! The graphics are simple but the style is one of the best with its cell shading-look. The Fighting-system isn't too complex but it is enough to keep you away from boredom. The story isnt complicated but well told. If you like action_adventures with level-you-character-up and collect-some-things mechanics AND with humor, this is for you!

This game is a great game, wonderfully put together, quirky, enchanting, and just all around fun!\nI havent found any bugs or broken things, and no downsides beside the fact that after every battle stats are reset, but they fix that in Costume Quest 2.\n9/10, the graphics could be a little better, and soundtrack is repetitive.
I bought it because the graphics reminded me of Animal Crossing. The game itself is nothing like Animal Crossing, but it's a neat and fun game with adorable graphics.
so good, 10/10 would recommend. i feel like a child again (: a+ times.
Funny, cute, clever and, above all, fun! Not the most complicated game you'll ever play, but it has a lot to offer to all ages of casual gamers.

Costume Quest is a pretty damn good game. It has some amazing scenes, the story is pretty nice, and the overall mechanics of the game are really enjoyable. The charactereres are really well designed some can give you a really good laugh the first time you see them. But now we get to the worst part, the gameplay. I was really into the storyline of the game but a part of me didnt want to end it because of the repetitive mechanics it has. The game is pretty much divided in 3 parts and the overall missions of each one are basicaly the same. i only did half of the things i did because i really had to do them in order to complete the story. Overall a good game if you like repetitive games and games were you need to explore every single place in order to get everything but expect a gameplay of around 5/6 hours to fully complete it. And dont forget you can only do one of the achievs on christmas.

Started this game as a distraction, ended up spending 11 hours playing and beating the game and got most of the way through the dlc. Sucked out my soul and stole my Sunday from me. 10/10 would play again.

This game simply oozes with charm. I enjoy the turn-based combat, although it, and a lot of the concepts, can get a bit repetitive. The levels are really fun to explore despite their small size, and the costumes are a nice mechanic. But, really, it's just so darned cute.

Short game, but super fun!!\nThe game itself is very simple and easy to play. The story is interesting in it's self and I found it entertaining. The gameplay of silly little costumes was very interesting and I enjoyed the game a lot, though it was very short and very easy to finish the game. I don't know if it's worth 10 dollars, but it might be worth to just buy it when it's on sale.
Great, somewhat simple RPG that has a fighting system I'd like to see used more: easy to understand, quick, and flashy.
Short, but gold ; )
An awesome RPG from Double Fine.
Not bad tbh... Like fi nal fantasy for the battles lol

Perfect game to get in the seasonal mood. Simple gameplay (think Paper Mario) mixed with a great style and humorous writting (After all, it is Tim Schafer) make this an entertaining tribute to what halloween used to mean...you know...before you started drinking...

i love the atmosphere of this game.  story telling is charming. i like the shell shaded art direction.   i love the dialogue sometimes, its so witty.  i love the world this game is placed in, its a short game, and i wish this game was longer.  on the other hand the game battle system is TOO repetitive.  VERY simple battle mechanics which is like a double edged sword. every battle in the game is very similar and it gets dull after awhile. dodging attacks is dead simple. as long as you get the timing right, that's all that matters. that is way too simple. but once you get the hang of the battle mechanics, the battles flow in and out of the world map very quickly which i likecontrols on the kb and mouse plain SUCKS, use an xbox controller.the last boss final phase is horribly over powered, they could have designed his moves better instead of a cheap wipe out the whole team" move. with all that said
date: this game was still loads of fun you should chekc it out!"

reviewText: This game makes me feel like a kid waiting for Halloween. The mood and setting is perfect, and Tim Schaefer's iconic wit is present throughout. I would recommend this game above any of the horror genre for Halloween. It's a pretty fun JRPG, but I wouldn't really play it unless it was close to its geared season.

This game is fun, but the fights are all the same which makes the game a little repetitive. But the environment is great, the story is funny, although really short (a few hours to finish the game, a few more to finish the DLC and/or get all side quests).\n\nIf you can buy it in a bundle or on sale, you should try it. Otherwise, wait for steam summer/winter sales ;)

I thought this was going to be some mediocre game but it actually suprised me. It's a very entertaining turn-based RPG set in a trick-or-treat environment. The story is not so creative and the gameplay is simple. But you get caught up playing this, that the hours fly by because you're enjoying it so much. You will have fun if you pick this game up.

Halloween has always been the only holiday I've enjoyed. As a kid it was my favourite by far, and as an adult it remains so. If you don't have siblings or kids of your own, some of that magic dissipates as you age. Costume Quest does wonders to bring back some of that nostalgia of the best night of the year.

It's been a long time since I truly enjoyed an rpg, and Costume Quest was no disappointment. I'd been waiting a long time to play it and I'm glad I finally did.  It took me about 10 hours to beat the base game and then the dlc.  The best part of this game was the imagination of the kids that allowed them to use their cardboard Halloween costumes as amazingly deadly characters in battle.  Truly a unique game.  I recommend this game to ANYONE of any age, whether you like rpgs or not.

Fantastic game from Double Fine!It's a cute game with typical Double Fine graphics, their humor, and general awesomeness. You play as either Reynold or Wren, twins on halloween night who are out trying to get as much candy as possible until they run into monsters and one is kidnapped. The combat is okay, it's turned-based QTE RPG stuff. The characters, the quests, and the overall look of the game is what's the best. Worth the  price, plus you get the DLC for it free. You'll probably get 8-10 hours out of it, but it's worth the ride!

First Steam game i ever 100 percented and it wasn't a a pain at all. Even though it stars kids, do not be fooled into thinking this is a kid's game. It requires a quick-time event with every attack so it keep you more involved than ususal turnbased RPGs

A simple, yet very fun RPG made by Double Fine Productions. Not very surprising, since the company is known for making pretty fun games. Costume Quest uses a simple turn-based RPG battle system, so there isn't really any kind of learning curve to it. The story is pretty simple and not deep, but the characters are likeable. The costumes you wear decide what you fight as and what attack and special ability you have. It can be pretty fun to mess around and decide what the best team to use is. The game isn't really hard, but if you don't have a good team set up, it can be easy to lose. Even if you lose, there is no penalty or anything of that sort, which is sort of nice. If your a fan of simple turn-based RPGs, I fully recommend you try this game. (Note: If you aren't very good with quick time events using keyboard butons, I fully recommend you use a controller, preferably an Xbox 360 controller.)

If you crazy kids like Halloween and RPG games, then this would be a great game to pick up and play in a breeze! You can't go wrong with Double Fine either, since they're the indie company behind Psychonauts. This is also a good game to play if you want to experience what an RPG is like upon a smooth and easy-to-play surface for all ages!
Just..just buy this game. It's sooooooooo good. It's sublime. It's an rpg by Double Fine. Just go. Buy it. Now.

Costume Quest is a short burst of fun, with the typical witty yet earnest writing that Double Fine make seem easy. It's not a very taxing game, but is fun to play and is over before it becomes too repetitive. Definitely worth a go.

This is the perfect gateway drug into more serious games.  Like the RPG equivalent of Portal, or like Final Fantasy Mystic Quest if that game had any coherent plot, or good design, or any interesting any thing at all going on.  That is what this game has.  Only downside?  Shorter than Danny DeVito.

Very simple combat mechanics probably intended for younger or casual gamers, but there's still plenty to enjoy here for a more hardcore player. The game isn't too long so it doesn't overstay its welcome, and the lighthearted nature of the story and dialogue is a delight to play through. All of the combat animations are awesome too, making going through performing side quests to collect more costume pieces well worth your time.
Great game. Simple but well worth a play through. Not much replay value but I still need to finish the expansion pack. Definite buy, though.

This is a great SNES type of RPG. It plays exactly like Earthbound, but graphically updated. It isn't a long game, but it is worth the price. There are some side quests, but there isn't anything to do, once you beat the game.\n\nRating: 8/10
Simple, but fast-paced Final Fantasy clone, with a touch of Zelda, its own colectibles, a few mini games, but, most importantly, the charm of a heartfelt  Halloween story for kids.
Warning: contains one of the most precious, adorable sights in the known and unknown space/time and alternate dimensions.
Best single player fun i've had for a while. If you like Halloween
hoursPlayed: then this is for you. Good humour.""

reviewText: Classic Double Fine humor and gameplay at its finest!  If you like RPGs and sarcastic humor, this one's for you.
This game is adorable. Regardless of one's age or gaming genre preference, this one is worth checking out, especially when it's available for under a couple bucks.

Costume Quest is by far one of my favorite Double Fine games ever produced. The quirky sense of humor, easily accessable gameplay, and overall style make it a great game to play over and over. A great game to play casually whenever you have some time to kill.
I like the art style and it's fun - not difficult at all, cartoony and whimsical.  Perfect to relax with!
An extremely chill RPG that is surprisingly fun and challenging enough to keep you playing.

Really cute game for Halloween. It's got a fairly interesting plot and the battles are pretty fun (turn-based). It requires some attentiveness in regards to the battles. Thought it was odd that Christmas was involved in one of the achievements, but overall, I think it's worth a play. I should have my last achievement of the game within the next two days since it's the Christmas achievement. :)
Phenomenal game.  One of the most fun (and most joyous) I've ever played.  Captures the magic of childhood Halloween, and is a fun rpg.
Halloween + RPG? Yes please.\nThe premise was charming enough, and the new ability to overcome new obstacle" method of progression never gets old."
Pretty great game. I love anything made my Double Fine and this is no exception! Fantastic gameplay and I seem to always be laughing from thegame's humor!

Another fun adorable game by Double Fine. Costume Quest is cute and the power ups are always a blast to watch. The RPG elements in this game are light and not overbearing. It's easy to pick up and play with most of the battles being simple quick-time events. This game is definitely worth the price and is great if you're looking for a light-hearted RPG to kill time.
Fairly easy game but it is rather fun to play if you like turn based RPG's. The game plus the DLC will probably take you only 7 hours to beat and 100%
Buy and play this game. 10/10 would reccomend.
Fun little game with puzzles and turn based combat that you can influence for critz! I love this little game! It is also themed after my favorite holiday... HALLOWEEN!!

Another amazing game from Double Fine!  It's a nice mix of exploration, combat, mini games and funny jokes.  The combat is simple, turn based, and each of the different costumes you collect gives you different fun abilities.  The story is charming, and all the side quests add to the fun.  The main campaign took me around 5 hrs, and I did every quest.  It comes with a free DLC which adds another hour and a half or so.  If you haven't played Stacking or Psychonauts, do that too!
A light-hearted but excellent take on the traditional turn based RPG genre. Highly recommended!

Play if you like clever writing and storytelling, and can do without fancy mechanics or puzzles.  It has a sense of humor to it.\n\nIt is sometimes (or was for me) difficult to read some of the action-key prompts activated in the battle sequences, and navigating the map on the diagonal felt a little clunkier than it needed to be, but that was definitely outweighed by the writing.

A cute, turn-based adventure from Tim Schaffer's company Double Fine, known for humor-ful games like Psychonauts, Monkey Island, Brutal Legend, etc.

While a bit short, it is just the right length for what it is. The combat is a mix of standard turn-based RPG fare, with a twist. You can make different costumes with materials you find which alter your fighting style.

If you want to relive your days of trick-or-treating, playing make believe, and grabbing all the candy you can, try this one out.

This is a very cute and charming game.  I'm finding I like games from this company I have fully played two of them now (this one and Stacking) and I love them both.  I used the older bratty sister, so I may play this again as the younger brother.  The art style is cartoonish, but that works for this game. I like the idea of these kids dressed up in broken down boxes and pretending to have superpowers. It's not overly long, but I enjoyed it.  I even found some of the fights hard at times.
This is a charming game by Double Fine, and I enjoyed it immensely. The battle system can get a bit repetitive after a few goes, but the best part of the game is the dialogue.
That's amazing!

Excellent game, especially for classic j-rpg fans. Great humor throughout, this game is equal doses badass and adorable. Definitely recommend playing with a controller, as the keyboard controls can be a little tiresome in this case.\nIt bears some resemblance to the new South Park game. I do not mean to say that the South Park guys have ripped Costume Quest off, as they both pay homage to older turn-based rpgs, but anyone who loved playing one of the two should play the other.\nPersonally I would love to see a sequel and more games like this. Make a sequel Double Fine!
I don't fancy myself a guy who calls things cute" but this game definitely was.  While so simple someone with an IQ of 10 could play

reviewText: Buy this! No really, it is SofaKing good. I regret not having played it before now.

Art: Very good, definitely holds up even at higher resolutions. Simple style and
Audio: Music riffs are repetitive, but not bad. SFX can be abrasive at times, but again not something that prevented me from enjoying the game.
Gameplay: Very simple battle structure that still allows for personalizing strategies. Easy to learn and not hard to master. Exploration is pretty basic but they spice it up with different costumes that let you engage in the environment in different ways. Not much to do with Candy (currency).
Feel: Feels polished and smooth. Fun and exciting halloween vibe. Enjoyable humor, simple and witty.

I enjoyed the Double Fine humour, charming characters and universe, simple and elegant mechanics, and found that overall the experience was very positive. I did not feel as though it was too short or shallow, as I imagine some people might. Movement and collision is occasionally awkward, and you may find yourself backtracking a little more than is necessary.

Such a creative and unique game. Everything from the setting to the story to the graphics scream creativity. And my kids also love playing it and have played through it. The gameplay, unfortunately, is a mix of creativity and dullness. The different costumes and their unique powers are unique and cool, but the fighting get so overly repetitive. It's very repetitive and not deep at all. Still, everything about Costume Quest makes up for it.\n

Can't say that I played too much of it, but it is entertaining and I am planning on eventually finishing it. So for about a hour and a half of gaming thus far, I'm not dissapointed with this little jewel here.

This is a cute little game about three friends who set out, not to save the world, but a friend and sibling. It's cute, funny and very easy. Do you wish you could just finish a game for once? Do you mind if there's a slightest taste of JRPG? Whatever you answer, give Costume Quest a chance, don't let the monsters win and destroy halloween.

awesome possum

I actually at first wasn't that interested to play this. I got this as a part of humblebundle, which bought cause of Brutal Legends. But Brutal Legends disappointed me( that is a different story). So I tried out this game.

And to my suprise, the game turned out to be quite fun that I completed it in the same day. The game is cute and fun to play. Although I think there isn't much replayablity in this game, unless you want to unlock full achivements.

However to make long story short. This game is quite enjoyable.

Great for younger gamers, and for those who want something different then the usual.  Extremely simple concept but can be challenging in some places.  The combat consists of button presses to match what is indicated on screen, repeating to fill a meter, rotate a stick, or push a button.\n\nPlaying with a gamepad, it is a good experience, otherwise it is tough to deal with.

The whole game takes place on Halloween night where you must rescue your twin brother (or sister, depending on who you choose) who has been kidnapped by candy-stealing monsters. You have to trick-or-treat at every lighted house to unlock other areas in the game world. If a monster opens a door you will engage in a random turn-based battle where your costume powers will come in handy.

On your quest you will meet other trick-or-treaters and pick up more followers for your search party. Collect candy from trash bags and smashed pumpkins which can be used to purchase perks in monster battles. Complete mini-quests to earn experience so you can level up. Do classic Halloween activities, like bob for apples and compete in a costume contest. Collect Creepy Treat trading cards and materials to unlock more costumes that have special abilities.

It's a unique blend of rpg-ing and casual gameplay that perfectly captures the spirit of Halloween. A must-have for those too old to trick-or-treat.

As expected it is easy but there are plenty of fun costumes to play around with as well as exploring for collectables. Worth buying purely for the humour and charm which is even found in the background characters.
Costume Quest is awesome.  As Halloween nears you should give it a play.  (Double Fine should be working on a sequal to or DLC for Costume Quest instead of making a documentary.)
Fantastic writing!

Such a creative and unique game. Everything from the setting to the story to the graphics scream creativity. And my kids also love playing it and have played through it. The gameplay, unfortunately, is a mix of creativity and dullness. The different costumes and their unique powers are unique and cool, but the fighting get so overly repetitive. It's very repetitive and not deep at all. Still, everything about Costume Quest makes up for it.\n

This is a cute little game about three friends who set out, not to save the world, but a friend and sibling. It's cute, funny and very easy. Do you wish you could just finish a game for once? Do you mind if there's a slightest taste of JRPG? Whatever you answer, give Costume Quest a chance, don't let the monsters win and destroy halloween.

I am completely in love with this game.  It's rather fun and just enough challenging to make you think a little without being realy hard or trying.

The main game has all sorts of chances for achievements and the costumes you aquire are really neat.

I enjoy the battle system.  It's a straight forward turn-based system, very old school RPG.  There's a little strategy involved, deciding what costume to wear and some are on by necessity along with what 'battle stamp' to use.

It's also nice that losing in a battle kicks you out of the battle, you're not 'dead' and go back to a previous point.

Only exception to this are boss battles but they point they send you is more to give you a chance to rethink your costume and stamp combos more than making you re-play levels.

My only real frusrtation is the graphics.  While fun and interesting, the level of detail lags my computer like crazy.  Even turning off shadowing and other features, navigating the leves and timing events in battle.

An absolutely FANTASTIC casual/action-adventure title, heavy on the adventure (with a bit of turn-based combat in there, to great effect). For the price, you'll get over 6 hours of universally-appealing gameplay for all ages out of just CQ, and even more from the included DLC.

This game is short and simplistic. The RPG combat is kinda like Paper Mario, in that you do QTEs to deal more damage. However, you usually only have the option to do a basic attack until your special is charged up (always after 3 turns) or you have a special stamp equipped. There are about ten costumes in both the normal game and the DLC, and only about half of them are worth using in combat compared to the others.

Outside of combat, there are four enviroments to explore and solve puzzles in using costume abilities. You can hit basically anyone and anything with your candy pail, which is amusing. The dialogue isn't laugh out loud funny, but I smiled from time to time.

The game really shines graphically. The characters are cute, the environments are given a lot of detail, and the battles look amazing. It's all very colorful. Music is average, however.

All in all, playing this game is like playing a cartoon from Cartoon Network long ago. Worth buying if it's on sale.

Well Double Fine you made another good game, I applaude you. See Double Fine continues to make good games, something few companies can do, much like RareWare in the 1990's, Tim Schafer's Double Fine seems to be dishing out game after game of quality. He is of course well known to the people who have heard of him, but that is shockingly few people. His games like Grim Fandango, and Phychonauts are glimmering underappreciated diamonds, and his lastest game Costume Quest does nothing to tarnish that reputation.

Now why do I compare Double Fine to Rare? Easy, they both made a multitude of games that made them very popular, Double Fines biggest issue is it is still the unknown company, thier games come out, they look cool to some people, I play them, love them, then I tell other people how good they are for just being 20 bucks or less, then no one plays them. But I hold no resentment towards those people because I grew up with with Tim at my side, a man that made good games, I do hope that someday I can say 'Hey, you know that game that everyone likes that just came out, try this it's made by the same guys.' Then we get people playing Double Fines old catalog of games.

But about Costume Quest, it's good, it's charming, it has a few pop culture references, most don't seem out of place unless you know them. But the big thing is, it shows that Double Fine can make a decent Role Playing Game. Now don't get me wrong it's not as in depth as some major RPG's, but it does what you want it to do. There are no voices, just text, which is fine, the dialouge makes me chuckle, and brings out the little things in characters. It's just enough exploration, it is a little limiting, but it cuts down on annoying long term searches, and overall the game keeps at a fairly difficult stance.

See it's these types of games that I like to see game companies make, they normally make puzzle games or platformers, but then they release an explore centered RPG and then it's actually good. That is what I like to see, I like to see companies improve and expand thier game base with more than platformers, because really I will lose intrest eventually, but it is safe to say Double Fine is keeping another fan interested and excited for the future.
Cute little game! It's not very challenging, but it has a nice story. Nice way to spend a lazy afternoon.

Somehow your halloween costume of a robot happens to turn into a real robot (only during the fights, but it's still awesome) so you can fight monsters that are stealing all the candies. The most incredible thing about that game is collecting and trying all the cool costumes. Fight is turn based,  Final Fantasy"-like conected with a little bit of agility. For me the main con of that game is lack of talk

The theme and mechanics of the game fit together perfectly but I can see how it might get repetitive and dull for other players. I've heard that the designers wanted to make this like playing through a Pixar movie, and it really shows.  It's got a charming and whimsical atmosphere that makes you feel like a kid again, and while the barrage of timed hits can sort of be annoying, the game's forgiving enough that it rarely becomes problematic.  Besides, who wouldn't want to be in a world where you can don a few cardboard boxes and turn into a rocket-punch-firing robot?

If you are wondering whether-or-not this game lives-up to the pedigree of video game humour that Double Fine has, this should answer your question. It has an Arrested Development reference.\n\nNot a perfect game, but still worth buying imo.

The game does a great job of facilitating just enough combat to keep you at the appropriate level without the need to do extra legwork.  All in all, I'd give it 4/5, and a high recommendation.
It's Halloween, you wear costumes and do quests. Really, what more do you want? Oh and it's funny too!

I bought this game during the christmas sale and by far, it is a really fun game. Although there are no voiceovers, the witty humor, battle system and exageration of the combat is very entertaining. It is a game that never takes itself too seriously and will keep you entertained for a good time. Hopefully, it will go on sale again!
